channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: バンクーバーを拠点とするIndigiNewsとオンタリオ州のThe Sarnia Journalのジャーナリストは、メタのニュースブロックがサイト訪問者を減らし、彼らの出版社に打撃を与えていると述べている（Khadijah Khogeer/NBC News）。
item.description:
Khadijah Khogeer / NBC News:
Journalists at Vancouver-based IndigiNews and The Sarnia Journal in Ontario say Meta's news block is reducing their site visitors and hurting their outlets  —  Meta recently began blocking news from Instagram and Facebook in Canada in response to the Online News Act.

item.title: X、7月31日の週に設定されていた広告収益分配プログラムの支払いを延期、登録者数が「予想を上回った」と発表（Richard Lawler/The Verge）
item.description:
Richard Lawler / The Verge:
X delays its ads revenue sharing program payouts that were set for the week of July 31, saying the volume of people signing up “has exceeded our expectations”  —  In news that isn't very surprising given the recent history of Twitter, which Elon Musk is currently rebranding to X …

item.title: 調査WaPo、NYT、WSJなどにも掲載されたサブスタックのライター、リチャード・ハナニアは、2010年代にペンネームを使って白人至上主義者向けの記事を書いていた（Christopher Mathias/HuffPost）
item.description:
Christopher Mathias / HuffPost:
Investigation: Richard Hanania, a Substack writer also published in WaPo, NYT, WSJ, and more, wrote for white supremacist outlets in the 2010s using a pen name  —  Hanania is championed by tech moguls and a U.S. senator, but HuffPost found he used a pen name to become an important figure in the “alt-right.”

item.title: 北米の放送局は、カナダにおけるメタのニュース禁止は「独占的」であるとし、パブリッシャーがテック・プラットフォームと交渉できるようにする規則を支持するよう議員に要請する（カナダ放送協会）
item.description:
Canadian Association of Broadcasters:
North American broadcasters say Meta's news ban in Canada is “monopolistic” and urge lawmakers to back rules enabling publisher negotiations with tech platforms  —  In response to Meta blocking news on Facebook and Instagram for Canadian users after the passage of Canada's Online News Act …

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙は、FTXの共同設立者であるサム・バンクマン・フリードが、元恋人キャロライン・エリソンの文章を同紙と共有したことから、箝口令が敷かれたとして争っている（André Beganski/Decrypt）。
item.description:
André Beganski / Decrypt:
The New York Times is fighting a gag order imposed on FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried after he shared former lover Caroline Ellison's writings with the outlet  —  The Gray Lady's letter follows a report that landed Bankman-Fried back in court. … The New York Times pushed back on Thursday …

item.title: WGAとSAG-AFTRAの組合員数千人がNBCユニバーサルをピケ。
item.description:
Deadline:
Thousands of WGA and SAG-AFTRA members picket NBCUniversal, after union members filed NLRB complaints saying the studio hindered earlier pickets  —  This is Day 95 of the WGA strike and Day 22 of the SAG-AFTRA strike  —  NBCUniversal has been at the center of a number of controversies involving …

item.title: ポルノへのアクセスを制限する新しい法律は、政府が「未成年者にとって有害な」コンテンツを決定することを妨げる憲法修正第1条の保護を回避している（Casey Newton/Platformer）
item.description:
Casey Newton / Platformer:
New laws restricting access to porn circumvent First Amendment protections that prevent the government from deciding what content is “harmful to minors”  —  Anti-speech laws are spreading from states to Congress, and the future of online speech could hang in the balance

item.title: ストライキが長引くハリウッドで食糧不足が深刻化しているため、NPOが脚本家、俳優、サポートスタッフのための食糧支援と経済援助を強化している（The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
The Hollywood Reporter:
Charities say food insecurity is rising in Hollywood as strikes linger, so nonprofits are boosting food and financial aid for writers, actors, and support staff  —  As the labor impasse continues, charities say growing numbers of the industry's most vulnerable are unable to feed themselves …

item.title: イエメン戦争とウクライナ戦争に関するNYTの見出しを比較したところ、報道の規模や論調に広範な偏りがあり、米国の外交政策と一致していることがわかった（The Conversation）。
item.description:
The Conversation:
A comparison of NYT headlines about the Yemen and Ukraine wars finds extensive biases in the scale and tone of coverage, aligning with US foreign policy  —  War entails suffering.  How and how often that suffering is reported on in the U.S., however, is not evenhanded.

item.title: オンライン・ページビューが減少する中、英リーチが2023年上半期に複数回の削減を行った編集スタッフの希望退職制度を開始（David Sharman/HoldtheFrontPage）
item.description:
David Sharman / HoldtheFrontPage:
With online page views declining, UK's Reach launches a voluntary redundancy scheme for editorial staff after multiple rounds of cuts in H1 2023  —  A decline in online page views has prompted a regional publisher to launch a voluntary redundancy scheme for editorial staff.

item.title: 地方政府に関する報道を生成する完全なAI駆動型サイト「LocalLens」を見てみよう。その目標は、ジャーナリストの出発点として機能することである（Joe Amditis/Center for Cooperative Media）
item.description:
Joe Amditis / Center for Cooperative Media:
A look at LocalLens, a completely AI-driven site that generates coverage of local government, whose stated goal is to serve as a starting point for journalists  —  It's not journalism, but does it have a role to play in the information ecosystem?  —  Imagine you're using a metal detector …

item.title: Fubo、第2四半期の売上高は前年同期比41%増の$312.7M、純損失$54.2M、加入者数は前年同期比23%増の117万人だが、第1四半期の129万人から減少（Luke Bouma/Cord Cutters News）
item.description:
Luke Bouma / Cord Cutters News:
Fubo reports Q2 revenue up 41% YoY to $312.7M, a $54.2M net loss, and 1.17M subscribers, up 23% YoY, but down from 1.29M in Q1  —  Today Fubo reported their 2nd quarter 2023 earnings and posted a loss of 118,000 subscribers in just three months.  In total, Fubo has 1,167,000 subscribers in North America …

item.title: AMCネットワークス第2四半期：純収入は前年同期比8％減の6億7800万ドル、調整後営業利益は同9.6％減の1億7600万ドル、ストリーミング契約者数は第1四半期から50万人減の1100万人（Jennifer Maas/Variety）
item.description:
Jennifer Maas / Variety:
AMC Networks Q2: net revenue fell 8% YoY to $678M and adjusted operating income fell 9.6% YoY to $176M; streaming subscribers fell 500K from Q1 to 11M  —  AMC Networks reported its second-quarter 2023 earnings Friday, revealing it had lost 500,000 more subscribers across its portfolio …

item.title: WGA代表は金曜日、5月のストライキ以来初めてAMPTPと会談し、契約交渉再開の可否について話し合った（Dawn Chmielewski/Reuters）
item.description:
Dawn Chmielewski / Reuters:
WGA representatives met with the AMPTP on Friday for the first time since the strike was called in May to discuss whether contract talks can resume  —  As the Hollywood writers' strike approaches the 100-day mark, Writers Guild of America (WGA) negotiators met on Friday with representatives …

item.title: 情報筋：プライベート・エクイティ会社KKRが、パラマウント・グローバルからサイモン＆シュスター社を約16億5000万ドルで買収する交渉を進めている（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: private equity firm KKR is in advanced talks to acquire Simon & Schuster from Paramount Global for around $1.65B  —  Book publisher was put up for sale for the second time after a judge blocked a previous deal with Penguin Random House  —  Private-equity firm KKR is in advanced talks …
